name: Legion of Super Heroes: Triplicate Girl Quiz | Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is Triplicate Girl's real name?
questions.explanation:
Luornu Durgo.

	Kari Wahlgren is the actress who supplied Luornu's voice for the WB animated series, "The Legion of Super Heroes".

questions.text: In 'Adventure Comics' #340 (Jan 1966), Triplicate Girl is apparently killed in battle.  What LSH adversary was responsible for this death?
questions.explanation:
Computo.

	Computo was build by Legion member Brainiac 5.  It was intended to be a mechanical assistant for the Legion, but it went rogue.

questions.text: A memorial is erected and a service is held for Triplicate Girl on a small asteroid that is utilized as a cemetery for fallen heroes from around the universe.  What is the name of this asteroid?
questions.explanation:
Shanghalla.

	Shanghalla would be the final resting place of at least eleven Legion members.

questions.text: It would be revealed that only one of Triplicate Girl's three bodies was actually killed.  Her remaining selves adopted the name Duo Damsel and continued to serve the Legion.  Which fellow Legionnaire did she eventually marry?
questions.explanation:
Bouncing Boy.

	The three incorrect answers are all other former Legionnaires who have died in battle.

questions.text: After her wedding, Duo Damsel resigns from active Legion membership.  She would then serve as a Legion Reservist and also as a member of the Legion of Substitute Heroes.  What additional role came to be known as her true calling?
options: Caretaker of the asteroid hero cemetery
questions.explanation:
Instructor at the Legion Academy.

	Duo Damsel and her husband never had children.  After their honeymoon, the couple originally set off to assist colonization efforts on a icy world known as Wondil IX.  They later returned to Earth and worked as Legion Academy instructors.

questions.text: Before marrying, Duo Damsel experienced something unique to inhabitants of her world.  After splitting, one of her bodies declared its own individuality.  What name did this second body declare for itself?
questions.explanation:
Lelith.

	This back up tale in 'Action Comics' #380 (1969) during a slow period in LSH publication would later be used to explain many thing about Duo Damsel and how she was different from other inhabitants of her home planet.

questions.text: Duo Damsel would experience the death of yet a second of her bodies at the hand of another long time Legion nemesis.  Who was it?
questions.explanation:
Time Trapper.

	This second death occurred in 1988.  In 1993 it was updated in a Glorith time altered story line that the second body was actually still alive.

questions.text: After the first Legion continuity reboot, Triplicate Girl would go by a different code name.  What was it?
questions.explanation:
Triad.

	After the initial reboot, most of the Legion members were given new code names that eliminated "Boy", "Girl", "Lass", and "Lad" from their Legion names.

questions.text: In the "Retroboot" and "New 52" continuities (2007-2015), our heroine's power has been upgraded.  She can produce as many replicates as desired, with no maximum established.  Based on this, her code name has been changed yet again.  What is it?
questions.explanation:
Duplicate Girl.

	After this power upgrade, she initially took the name Duplicate Damsel.  Subsequently she opted for the name Duplicate Girl.  She once again was married, and was retired from the Legion, serving only as a reservist, along with her husband.

questions.text: What is Triplicate Girl's home planet?
questions.explanation:
Cargg.

	Cargg (sometimes Carggg) has three suns.  This was the original reason given for why it's inhabitants could all split into three separate beings!
